The queried Chlorophytes included <i>C. reinhardtii</i>; <i>Volvox carteri</i>; <i>Coccomyxa subellipsoidea</i> C-169; <i>Chlorella variabilis</i> NC64A; <i>O. tauri</i>; <i>O. lucimarinus</i>; <i>Micromonas pusilla</i> CCMP1545; <i>Micromonas</i> sp. RC299. The queried databases included the <i>Chlamydomonas</i> CiliaCut protein set [<a data-track="click" data-track-action="reference anchor" data-track-label="link" data-test="citation-ref" aria-label="Reference 49" title="Merchant SS, Prochnik SE, Vallon O, Harris EH, Karpowicz SJ, Witman GB, Terry A, Salamov A, Fritz-Laylin LK, Marechal-Drouard L, et al. The Chlamydomonas genome reveals the evolution of key animal and plant functions. Science. 2007;318(5848):245–51." href="/articles/10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x#ref-CR49" id="ref-link-section-d4765e6745">49</a>], the <i>Chlamydomonas</i> flagella proteome [<a data-track="click" data-track-action="reference anchor" data-track-label="link" data-test="citation-ref" aria-label="Reference 266" title="Pazour GJ, Agrin N, Leszyk J, Witman GB. Proteomic analysis of a eukaryotic cilium. J Cell Biol. 2005;170(1):103–13." href="/articles/10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x#ref-CR266" id="ref-link-section-d4765e6751">266</a>, <a data-track="click" data-track-action="reference anchor" data-track-label="link" data-test="citation-ref" aria-label="Reference 267" title="Yang PF, Diener DR, Yang C, Kohno T, Pazour GJ, Dienes JM, Agrin NS, King SM, Sale WS, Kamiya R, et al. Radial spoke proteins of Chlamydomonas flagella. J Cell Sci. 2006;119(6):1165–74." href="/articles/10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x#ref-CR267" id="ref-link-section-d4765e6754">267</a>] and protein families ubiquitous in motile chlorophytes but absent in non-motile chlorophytes (Fig. <a data-track="click" data-track-label="link" data-track-action="figure anchor" href="/articles/10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x#Fig5">5</a>). The latter proteins were referred to as Chlorophyte CiliaCut in reference to work by Merchant et al. [<a data-track="click" data-track-action="reference anchor" data-track-label="link" data-test="citation-ref" aria-label="Reference 49" title="Merchant SS, Prochnik SE, Vallon O, Harris EH, Karpowicz SJ, Witman GB, Terry A, Salamov A, Fritz-Laylin LK, Marechal-Drouard L, et al. The Chlamydomonas genome reveals the evolution of key animal and plant functions. Science. 2007;318(5848):245–51." href="/articles/10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x#ref-CR49" id="ref-link-section-d4765e6761">49</a>], and contain candidate flagella proteins. A majority (69/95 = 68%) of the 95 <i>Asterochloris</i> proteins in the Chlorophyte CiliaCut are orthologs to proteins of the <i>Chlamydomonas</i> CiliaCut or <i>Chlamydomonas</i> flagella proteome.</p><h3 class="c-article__sub-heading" id="Sec35">Tests of relative evolutionary rates</h3><p>Three methods were used to assess evolutionary rates in <i>C. grayi</i> and <i>A. glomerata</i> relative to the 11 fungal and 6 algal taxa and alignments described in the multigene family prediction methods. The first protocol used HyPhy [<a data-track="click" data-track-action="reference anchor" data-track-label="link" data-test="citation-ref" aria-label="Reference 268" title="Pond SLK, Frost SDW, Muse SV. HyPhy: hypothesis testing using phylogenies. Bioinformatics. 2005;21(5):676–9." href="/articles/10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x#ref-CR268" id="ref-link-section-d4765e6788">268</a>] to determine substitution rates for each individual conserved orthogroup from aligned mutual best BLAST hit orthologs present in all taxa (2455 in the ascomycetes and 1454 in the chlorophytes). Rates of <i>C. grayi</i> and <i>A. glomerata</i> genes were considered reduced or accelerated if predictions matched in at least 90% of all analyzed triplets and rates were below the significance threshold (<i>p</i>-value &lt;= 0.05), while only nonsignificant values were scored in remaining triplets. In the second protocol, HyPhy was applied to the multigene families predicted through MCL [<a data-track="click" data-track-action="reference anchor" data-track-label="link" data-test="citation-ref" aria-label="Reference 135" title="Enright AJ, Van Dongen S, Ouzounis CA. An efficient algorithm for large-scale detection of protein families. Nucleic Acids Res. 2002;30(7):1575–84." href="/articles/10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x#ref-CR135" id="ref-link-section-d4765e6801">135</a>]. To detect anomalous evolutionary rates, the third protocol used likelihood ratios applied to the same orthogroups used in the other protocols. Since it is applied here for the first time, the third protocol is detailed in Additional file <a data-track="click" data-track-label="link" data-track-action="supplementary material anchor" href="/articles/10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x#MOESM13">13</a>.</p></div></div></section>
                    <section aria-labelledby="abbreviations" data-title="Abbreviations"><div class="c-article-section" id="abbreviations-section"><h2 class="c-article-section__title js-section-title js-c-reading-companion-sections-item" id="abbreviations">Abbreviations</h2><div class="c-article-section__content" id="abbreviations-content"><dl class="c-abbreviation_list"><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>AICc:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Corrected Akaike’s information criterion</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>ALDH:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Aldehyde dehydrogenase</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>AM:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Arbuscular mycorrhizae</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>ANK:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Ankyrin domain</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>ATO:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Ammonia Transport Outward</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>BLAST(P):</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Basic Local Alignment Search Tool (Proteins)</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>BLASTX:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Protein databases search using a translated nucleotide query</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>CA:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Carbonic anhydrase</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>CAFE:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Computational Analysis of gene Family Evolution</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>CAZ:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">

                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>CCHC:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">

                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>Co/Mo:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">

                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>CTAB:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Cetyltrimethyl ammonium bromide</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>DRP:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Desiccation-Related Protein</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>dsDNA:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Double-stranded DNA</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>EM:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Ectomycorrhizae</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>ESR:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Environmental Stress Response</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>EST:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Expressed Sequence Tags</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>GO:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Gene Ontology</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>GPCR:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>G Protein-Coupled Receptor</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>HANT-AC:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>High Affinity Nitrate Transporter-Assimilation Cluster</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>HET:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Heterokaryon incompatibility</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>HGT:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Horizontal gene transfer</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>ITS:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Internal Transcribed Spacer</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>JTT:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Jones-Taylor-Thornton model of protein evolution</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>KEGG:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>LAT:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>L-type amino acid Transporter</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>LG:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Le-Gascuel model of protein evolution</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>LSU:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Large ribosomal subunit gene</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>MAG:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Magnaporthe grisea-like Gα protein</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>MAPK:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Mitogen Activated Protein Kinase</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>Mb:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Megabases</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>MCL:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Markov Cluster Algorithm</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>MEP:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Methylammonium Permease-type transporters</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>MFS:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Major Facilitator Superfamily</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>ML:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Maximum likelihood</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>MY:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Malt Yeast extract</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>NAR:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Nitrate reductase</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>NAR-P:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Nitrate reductase paralog</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>NCLDV:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Nucleo-cytoplasmic large DNA viruses</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>NIR:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Nitrite reductase</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>NJ:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Neighbor Joining</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>NNP:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Nitrate/Nitrite Porter</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>NRPS:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Non-Ribosomal Peptide Synthases</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>NRT3:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Nitrate transport related</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>ORF:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Open Reading Frame</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>PFAM:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Protein Family database</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>PhyML:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Maximum Likelihood Phylogeny estimation</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>PKS:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Polyketide synthase</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>PS II:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Photosystem II</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>RGS:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Regulators of G-protein Signaling</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>RIN:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>RNA Integrity Number</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>RPKM:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Reads Per Kilobase of gene sequence per Million aligned sequences</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>SET domain:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Su(var)3-9, Enhancer-of-zeste and Trithorax</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>SSU:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Small ribosomal subunit gene</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>TBLASTN:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Translated nucleotide databases search using a protein query</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>TBLASTX:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Translated nucleotide databases search using a translated nucleotide query</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>TCDB:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Transporter Classification Database</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>TE:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Tris EDTA buffer</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>TF:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Transcription factor</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>TM:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Transmembrane</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>TransportTP:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Membrane transporter prediction and characterization program</p>
                  </dd><dt class="c-abbreviation_list__term"><dfn>WAG:</dfn></dt><dd class="c-abbreviation_list__description">
                    <p>Whelan-Goldman model of protein evolution</p>
                  </dd></dl></div></div></section><section aria-labelledby="Bib1" data-title="References"><div class="c-article-section" id="Bib1-section"><h2 class="c-article-section__title js-section-title js-c-reading-companion-sections-item" id="Bib1">References</h2><div class="c-article-section__content" id="Bib1-content"><div data-container-section="references"><ol class="c-article-references"><li class="c-article-references__item js-c-reading-companion-references-item" itemprop="citation" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/ScholarlyArticle"><meta itemprop="author" content="R.                 <h3 class="c-article__sub-heading" id="FPar1">Funding</h3>
                <p>This work was supported by an intramural seed grant (IGSP 2008001) to DA, FL, and FD from the Duke Institute of Genomic Sciences and Policy (for DNA sequencing and assembly); by a three-year subcontract to DA, FL, and FD (for bioinformatics) from a DOE grant No 112442 to Pacific Northwest National Laboratory; and by a DOE-Biological Environmental Research grant No FWP 61327 to FRC and PL (for RNAseq). The work at the Joint Genome Institute is supported by the U.S. DOE Office of Science under Contract No. DE-AC02-05CH11231. The work of MP, DL and SSM was supported by the U.S. DOE Office of Science, Office of Biological and Environmental Research program under Award No DE-FC02-02ER63421. The meiosis gene identification was performed in the context of work supported by the National Science Foundation under Grant No. 1011101 to E.S. and J.M.L. The funding bodies were not involved in the design of the study, the collection, analysis, and interpretation of data or in writing the manuscript.</p>
              
                <h3 class="c-article__sub-heading" id="FPar2">Availability of data and materials</h3>
                <p>The assembled and annotated genomes, as indicated in Methods, are available at the DOE Joint Genome Institute Portal (<a href="http://genome.jgi.doe.gov/">http://genome.jgi.doe.gov/</a>). Most other relevant data are contained, or their sources indicated, in Additional files. Other datasets used and/or analysed during the current study are available from the corresponding author on reasonable request. For the sequenced mycobiont <i>Cgr/DA2myc/ss</i>, the Culture Bank accession # is CBS 132746 the GenBank ITS accession # is KC592272. The sequence accession # for the <i>MAT1–2</i> gene is MH795990.</p>
              </div></div></section><section aria-labelledby="author-information" data-title="Author information"><div class="c-article-section" id="author-information-section"><h2 class="c-article-section__title js-section-title js-c-reading-companion-sections-item" id="author-information">Author information</h2><div class="c-article-section__content" id="author-information-content"><h3 class="c-article__sub-heading" id="affiliations">Affiliations</h3><ol class="c-article-author-affiliation__list"><li id="Aff1"><p class="c-article-author-affiliation__address">Department of Biology, Duke University, Durham, USA</p><p class="c-article-author-affiliation__authors-list">Daniele Armaleo, Olaf Müller, François Lutzoni, Suzanne Joneson, Susan P.                         <span class="c-article-identifiers"><a class="c-article-identifiers__item" href="http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/query.fcgi?cmd=search&amp;term=Claire+Veneault-Fourrey" data-track="click" data-track-action="author link - pubmed" data-track-label="link">PubMed</a><span class="u-hide"> </span><a class="c-article-identifiers__item" href="http://scholar.google.co.uk/scholar?as_q=&amp;num=10&amp;btnG=Search+Scholar&amp;as_epq=&amp;as_oq=&amp;as_eq=&amp;as_occt=any&amp;as_sauthors=%22Claire+Veneault-Fourrey%22&amp;as_publication=&amp;as_ylo=&amp;as_yhi=&amp;as_allsubj=all&amp;hl=en" data-track="click" data-track-action="author link - scholar" data-track-label="link">Google Scholar</a></span></p></div></div></li><li id="auth-Basil_B_-Xavier"><span class="c-article-authors-search__title u-h3 js-search-name">Basil B. Xavier</span><div class="c-article-authors-search__list"><div class="c-article-authors-search__item c-article-authors-search__list-item--left"><a href="https://www.biomedcentral.com/search?query=author%23&#34;Basil B.+Xavier&#34;" class="c-article-button" data-track="click" data-track-action="author link - publication" data-track-label="link">View author publications</a></div><div class="c-article-authors-search__item c-article-authors-search__list-item--right"><p class="search-in-title-js c-article-authors-search__text">You can also search for this author in
                        <span class="c-article-identifiers"><a class="c-article-identifiers__item" href="http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/query.fcgi?cmd=search&amp;term=Basil B.+Xavier" data-track="click" data-track-action="author link - pubmed" data-track-label="link">PubMed</a><span class="u-hide"> </span><a class="c-article-identifiers__item" href="http://scholar.google.co.uk/scholar?as_q=&amp;num=10&amp;btnG=Search+Scholar&amp;as_epq=&amp;as_oq=&amp;as_eq=&amp;as_occt=any&amp;as_sauthors=%22Basil B.+Xavier%22&amp;as_publication=&amp;as_ylo=&amp;as_yhi=&amp;as_allsubj=all&amp;hl=en" data-track="click" data-track-action="author link - scholar" data-track-label="link">Google Scholar</a></span></p></div></div></li></ol></div><h3 class="c-article__sub-heading" id="contributions">Contributions</h3><p>DA conceived and directed the study, wrote grant proposals, devised the experiments and general analyses, collected the natural specimens, isolated and maintained the strains, developed the coculture methods and the protocols for DNA and RNA extraction, curated and analyzed the bioinformatics data, prepared most figures and tables, wrote and revised the manuscript. OM generated most of the bioinformatics data: assemblies and annotations, gene family analyses and, with NR, evolutionary rate analyses; NR developed the likelihood-based heterotachy detection method. AK and IVG were instrumental in implementing genomic reassembly and in setting up the JGI portals. PL and FRC sequenced coculture RNA and contributed to its analysis. DA, FL and FD were co-PIs on the grant proposals; FD conducted early bioinformatic analyses setting the stage for subsequent work, and FL co-supervised with DA the work of OM. GB analyzed algal synteny, the flagellar proteome and the viral insertion in the alga. MP and DL provided general KEGG-based gene categorizations and, with SSM, specific web portals for functional gene analysis and sequence retrieval. ES and JML identified the meiosis-specific genes in the alga. SPM assisted DA in the laboratory procedures. RO contributed to the coculture setups. FM, EM and CVF analyzed gene families and the fungal transportome. JS analyzed nitrate gene clusters. SJ, FDG, IS, and HBB were involved in the PKS-NRPS analysis and SJ reannotated manually several genes. BBX, OSA, VM and MVSP were involved in the assembly and analysis of the organellar genomes. VM and TRM contributed to the sequencing and analysis of the <i>MAT</i> loci. DS and NT analyzed signal transduction components. PS analyzed transcription factor families. FL, VM, RO, JS, SSM, ES, and PS also provided extensive feedback on the manuscript. All authors read and approved the final manuscript.</p><h3 class="c-article__sub-heading" id="corresponding-author">Corresponding author</h3><p id="corresponding-author-list">Correspondence to
                <a id="corresp-c1" rel="nofollow" href="/articles/10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x/email/correspondent/c1/new">Daniele Armaleo</a>.</p></div></div></section><section aria-labelledby="ethics" data-title="Ethics declarations"><div class="c-article-section" id="ethics-section"><h2 class="c-article-section__title js-section-title js-c-reading-companion-sections-item" id="ethics">Ethics declarations</h2><div class="c-article-section__content" id="ethics-content">
              
                <h3 class="c-article__sub-heading" id="FPar3">Ethics approval and consent to participate</h3>
                <p>Not applicable</p>

                <h3 class="c-article__sub-heading" id="FPar6">Publisher’s Note</h3>
                <p>Springer Nature remains neutral with regard to jurisdictional claims in published maps and institutional affiliations.</p>
              
            </div></div></section><section aria-labelledby="additional-information" data-title="Additional information"><div class="c-article-section" id="additional-information-section"><h2 class="c-article-section__title js-section-title js-c-reading-companion-sections-item" id="additional-information">Additional information</h2><div class="c-article-section__content" id="additional-information-content">
              <p><i>Dedicated to Chicita Culberson, a mentor and friend who laid the groundwork on Cladonia grayi</i></p>
            </div></div></section><section aria-labelledby="Sec36" data-title="Additional files"><div class="c-article-section" id="Sec36-section"><h2 class="c-article-section__title js-section-title js-c-reading-companion-sections-item" id="Sec36">Additional files</h2><div class="c-article-section__content" id="Sec36-content"><div data-test="supplementary-info"><div id="figshareContainer" class="c-article-figshare-container" data-test="figshare-container"></div>
                  
                  
                  
                  
                  
                  
                  
                  
                  
                  
                  
                  
                  
                <div class="c-article-supplementary__item" data-test="supp-item" id="MOESM1"><h3 class="c-article-supplementary__title u-h3"><a class="print-link" data-track="click" data-track-action="view supplementary info" data-track-label="link" data-test="supp-info-link" href="https://static-content.springer.com/esm/art%3A10.1186%2Fs12864-019-5629-x/MediaObjects/12864_2019_5629_MOESM1_ESM.docx" data-supp-info-image="">Additional file 1:</a></h3><div class="c-article-supplementary__description" data-component="thumbnail-container"><p>Organelle genomes and maps. (DOCX 22 kb)</p></div></div></div></div></div></section><section aria-labelledby="rightslink" data-title="Rights and permissions"><div class="c-article-section" id="rightslink-section"><h2 class="c-article-section__title js-section-title js-c-reading-companion-sections-item" id="rightslink">Rights and permissions</h2><div class="c-article-section__content" id="rightslink-content">
                <p><b>Open Access</b> This article is distributed under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (<a href="http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/" rel="license" itemprop="license">http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/</a>), which permits unrestricted use, distribution, and reproduction in any medium, provided you give appropriate credit to the original author(s) and the source, provide a link to the Creative Commons license, and indicate if changes were made. The Creative Commons Public Domain Dedication waiver (<a href="http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/" rel="license" itemprop="license">http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/</a>) applies to the data made available in this article, unless otherwise stated.</p>
              <p class="c-article-rights"><a data-track="click" data-track-action="view rights and permissions" data-track-label="link" href="https://s100.copyright.com/AppDispatchServlet?title=The%20lichen%20symbiosis%20re-viewed%20through%20the%20genomes%20of%20Cladonia%20grayi%20and%20its%20algal%20partner%20Asterochloris%20glomerata&amp;author=Daniele%20Armaleo%20et%20al&amp;contentID=10.1186%2Fs12864-019-5629-x&amp;copyright=The%20Author%28s%29.&amp;publication=1471-2164&amp;publicationDate=2019-07-23&amp;publisherName=SpringerNature&amp;orderBeanReset=true&amp;oa=CC%20BY%20%2B%20CC0">Reprints and Permissions</a></p></div></div></section><section aria-labelledby="article-info" data-title="About this article"><div class="c-article-section" id="article-info-section"><h2 class="c-article-section__title js-section-title js-c-reading-companion-sections-item" id="article-info">About this article</h2><div class="c-article-section__content" id="article-info-content"><div class="c-bibliographic-information"><div class="u-hide-print c-bibliographic-information__column c-bibliographic-information__column--border"><a data-crossmark="10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x" target="_blank" rel="noopener" href="https://crossmark.crossref.org/dialog/?doi=10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x" data-track="click" data-track-action="Click Crossmark" data-track-label="link" data-test="crossmark"><img width="57" height="81" alt="Verify currency and authenticity via CrossMark" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," /></a></div><div class="c-bibliographic-information__column"><h3 class="c-article__sub-heading" id="citeas">Cite this article</h3><p class="c-bibliographic-information__citation">Armaleo, D., Müller, O., Lutzoni, F. <i>et al.</i> The lichen symbiosis re-viewed through the genomes of <i>Cladonia grayi</i> and its algal partner <i>Asterochloris glomerata</i>.
                    <i>BMC Genomics</i> <b>20, </b>605 (2019). https://doi.org/10.1186/s12864-019-5629-x</p><p class="c-bibliographic-information__download-citation u-hide-print"><a
